channel.description: Recent content in Aquarium on Samuel Kindylides

item.title: New project test : Self-sustaining aquarium
item.description: What makes a self-sustaining aquarium The basic idea behind a self-sustaining aquarium is to create an aquarium which inhabitants don't need constant care to survive. You don't need to add anything to the aquarium, and you don't need to take anything out. The only outside help you need to provide is light and the addition of water from time to time. Creating perfect balance in such a restrained space is a pretty complicated feat to accomplish, requiring a lot of patience and potentially multiple attempts to succeed.
